DataElement.preferredName: Patient Referral Edmonton Frail Scale Outcome To Primary Care Doctor Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether a patient was referred to a primary care physician based on the results of the Edmonton Frail Scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Referral Edmonton Frail Scale Outcome To Primary Care Doctor
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Sending a patient from one practitioner to another for health care services._An assessment tool designed to be used by clinicians to assess the frailty of older patients. It assesses 10 domains including cognitive impairment and balance and mobility._The result of an action._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._A doctor who manages a person's health care over time. A primary care doctor is able to give a wide range of care, including prevention and treatment, can discuss cancer treatment choices, and can refer a patient to a specialist.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:Sending a patient from one practitioner to another for health care services.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
Sending a patient from one practitioner to another for health care services.

Property.preferredName: Edmonton Frail Scale Outcome To Primary Care Doctor
Property.preferredDefinition: An assessment tool designed to be used by clinicians to assess the frailty of older patients. It assesses 10 domains including cognitive impairment and balance and mobility.:The result of an action.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:A doctor who manages a person's health care over time. A primary care doctor is able to give a wide range of care, including prevention and treatment, can discuss cancer treatment choices, and can refer a patient to a specialist.

Concepts.definition: An assessment tool designed to be used by clinicians to assess the frailty of older patients. It assesses 10 domains including cognitive impairment and balance and mobility.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.

A medical professional who provides, coordinates, or helps a patient access a range of health care services. This is usually a medical doctor (MD), but may also be a Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine, nurse practitioner, clinical nurse specialist, or physician assistant, as allowed under state law.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016
